reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent three nights at the stadthotel Dusseldorf and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location, just a 10 minute walk to the Alstadt, but with plenty of shops, bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. There is also a bar joined on to the hotel reception. The room we has was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed for a short stay, including a map of the city which we found useful. the breakfast was fine for the price, with plenty of breads, cold meat, cheese, eggs, bacon, yoghurt and a waffle maker. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Nice location, great value

reviews.text: This hotel was double the price simply because there was a fair on while I was staying there.
reviews.title: Beware of the fair!

reviews.text: The price was double the normal rate which I had no problem with until I realised that it was far from fully-booked. In the morning at 9 a.m. there were 2 other people having breakfast and only 4 or 5 tables had been set and I only saw or heard 2 or 3 people in the lift or lobby. I feel this practice of greatly inflating prices is unfair particularly when the hotel is far from full.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself is fine - reasonably quiet, the room was clean, spacious with a big bathroom and breakfast was average. All ok but not at that price.
reviews.title: whatch out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and bright room, excellent location, but stuff should work on their English. That is not objection, but suggestion. Hotel is modern and light; but restoran is completely opposite - dark and old.
reviews.title: Clean, Modern, Nice Hotel!
